name: Abilities
description: The actions you can take in combat, based on the jobs you have taken. You can have six abilities active on any expedition, and one Limit Break. All abilities have talents which are unlockable improvements to each ability. All abilities, even Limit Breaks, have a Mastery which further improves the ability.

name: Arc X
description: X contiguous spaces, with at least one directly adjacent to the origin space. If it has a listed range, can be placed in range. Spaces must be drawn sequentially, in orthogonal directions, and cannot overlap, but otherwise can be placed in any pattern. Attack space is the final space.

name: Armor X
description: Reduce all damage by X

name: AoE
description: Area of effect, usually has a specific pattern. Only one space in an area of effect is the attack space and requires a roll, the others apply area effects automatically. AoE effects include Line, Blast, Close blast, Arc, and Cross.

name: Aura X
description: This ability is a continuous, ongoing effect that affects all characters within range X of a character, including that character. Characters are only affected by an aura while inside.

name: Auto-hit
description: This attack doesn’t require an attack roll but automatically hits. Auto-hit attacks cannot critical hit.

name: Basic Attack
description: (1 or 2 Actions) Make a basic light or heavy attack.

name: Blast X
description: A central space, with x spaces around it in every direction, placed in the range listed from the origin space. Attack space is the central space.

name: Blessing
description: Certain abilities give characters a Blessing token. A character can spend an action and a blessing token to cure themselves. All Mendicant jobs also have different ways to use blessings tokens. All blessings are discarded at the end of combat.

name: Blight
description: The Blights are Burning, Electrified, Poisoned, and Frostbite. A character affected by a particular blight takes bonus damage from any ability that would deal that blight again. For example, a burning character would take bonus damage from any ability that inflicts burning. Abilities may gain additional powerful effects against blighted characters.

name: Bloodied
description: At or under 50% hp.

name: Boon
description: For each boon, roll 1d6, pick the highest total result, then add it to your d20 roll total. Boons and curses cancel out each other, 1 to 1.

name: Charge
description: When used on a slow turn, this ability becomes more powerful.

name: Close blast X
description: A blast that must be placed so that at least one space of the total area is adjacent to the origin space.

name: Combo
description: Actions with Combo have two versions, a base version and combo version. When you use a base combo action, the next time you use any combo action, it uses its Combo version. When you use a Combo version of any combo action, the next combo action uses its base version.

name: Cover
description: If a character has cover from a ranged attack, it is resistant to that attack, halving all damage.

name: Cross X
description: X spaces in every orthogonal direction, drawn from a space in range. Attack space is the central space.

name: Cure
description: A character that’s cured can immediately clear a status or blight. Then, if that character is bloodied, they gain vigor 1.

name: Curse
description: For each curse, roll 1d6, pick the highest, and subtract it from your d20 total. Boons and curses cancel out each other, 1 to 1.

name: [D]
description: Your class’ damage die.

name: Damage
description: Damage in ICON depends on your job. Every class has a damage die (d6, d8, etc) which is often written as [D], and a fray damage value (a fixed amount).

name: Dash
description: (1 Action) Dash half your speed, rounded up. This is special movement that ignores engagement.

name: Defense
description: How hard it is to land a blow on you in combat. A hostile character must beat or match your defense with a to-hit roll to hit you with an attack (and you have to do the same to them). Anything lower is a miss.

name: Delay
description: Slow but powerful effect. When you use a delay effect, your next turn must be slow. The effect occurs at the start of that turn, before anything else happens.

name: Fray damage
description: Fixed damage, based on job. Usually added to all attacks on hit or miss.

name: The Great Wheel
description:
2 - The Fool - Ally must dash 3 spaces in a straight line before using the action.
3 - The Scepter - Teleport your ally to an adjacent space to you after the action resolves.
4 - The Ewer - Cure your ally and all characters adjacent to them at the end of the character’s turn.
5 - The Devil - If the next ability forces saves, foes get +1 curse to save against them.
6 - The Sword - Next ability gains pierce.
7 - Death - Ally gains Defiance.
8 - The Chariot - Ally’s movement during the ability can’t be reduced in any way.
9 - The Papessa - Ally becomes pacified and gains vigor 1
10 - The Emperor - Ally gains stealth
J - The Star - Ally makes all attacks and saves with +1 Boon until the end of their next turn.
Q - The Moon - Ally gains Evasion until end of their next turn
K - The Sun - Ally gains Counter and Sturdy, but cannot gain or benefit from stealth or evasion until end of their next turn
A - The World - Ally becomes Unstoppable until the end of their next turn

name: Hit Points
description: 4x your VIT, representing your character’s physical state, energy, and ability to avoid damage. Once you run out and go to 0, you are defeated. You’re incapacitated (can’t do anything, need help to get up) and take a wound. Certain abilities care about if a character is bloodied, which is at or below 50% max hit points. Characters always heal to bloodied after combat is over.

name: Immobile
description: When a character is immobile, they can’t move in any way. However, other characters can still shove or teleport them.

name: Immune to X
description: Not affected by X in any way. A character that’s immune to damage or effects doesn’t even count as taking them.

name: Incapacitated
description: Immobile, can’t take actions, interrupts, movement, or use abilities. Characters that are defeated are incapacitated by default.

name: Interact
description: (1 Action) Interact with something on the map that takes more than a few moments, such as pulling a lever, opening a heavy door, picking up a heavy object, etc.

name: Limit Break
description: Abilities (with an action cost, etc) that may or may not be attacks, and don’t count against number of abilities taken. All Limit Breaks cost a unique resource, called Resolve, to use, and a character can only limit break once per combat. When you spend Resolve to use a limit break, you can use any combination of party or personal resolve, but party resolve is shared between all members of the group, so any use of it must be used with the consent of your your team members. Resolve is always spent at the beginning of the action.

name: Line X
description: A line of X spaces long, with at least 1 space adjacent to the origin space, drawn in a cardinal direction from a space adjacent to the origin space. Attack space is any character in the area.

name: Mark
description: Place your mark on a specific character. You can only place one mark at a time on each character and each unique mark can only be active once at a time. If you place a new mark on a character with a mark from you, you can choose which to keep or which to discard. Marks end when the character that placed the mark is defeated, or under other conditions.

name: Obstruction
description: A character can’t move through something that causes obstruction. By default this means foes and objects.

name: Ongoing Status
description: Ongoing statuses cannot be purged, removed, or avoided (for example, by becoming sturdy or unstoppable).

name: Power Die
description: Some abilities will grant you a power die, and tell you to tick it up or untick it depending on certain conditions. You can use a physical die to represent it, or just a tracker. Each power die is unique to the ability that granted it. Gain power dice at 1 tick, and if a power die ticks to 0, discard it.

name: Rescue
description: (1 Action) Help an adjacent defeated ally. They end the incapacitated state on themselves and heal to full hit points, minus any wounds they’ve taken.

name: Resistance
description: Take 1/2 damage, rounded up.

name: Resolve
description: Resolve is a resource you build up slowly over combat and you must spend to use your most powerful abilities, called Limit Breaks. Resolve is split into two pools, party and personal resolve. Party Resolve goes up by 1 at the start of each round in combat, and depletes to 0 after combat ends. Personal resolve is gained at a rate of 1 after every combat, and resets to 0 after you camp. You might want to push on instead of resting in order to get the most out of your abilities.

name: Saves
description: When you make a save against a hostile effect, roll 1d20, and save against the effect on an 10+, usually resisting or ending it.

name: Shove X
description: Move a character involuntarily X spaces in a straight line away from you. If they would move into another character’s space, an object, or a higher level of terrain, they Collide and stop, taking damage equal to shove amount, which cannot reduce them below 1 hp. Colliding triggers some abilities or traits. Each unique collide effect can only trigger once per turn on each character.

name: Size
description: How many spaces square you take up on the battlefield. Player character are all size 1, and take up a 1x1 area.

name: Slay
description: An effect that triggers when this action reduces a character to 0 hp. Can only trigger once per ability by default.

name: Slow Turn
description: Go after all other characters. If multiple characters take slow turns, it takes the same order as regular turns (ally/enemy/ally).

name: Speed
description: Affects how far you may move when you take a standard move (full speed) or dash (half speed).

name: Stance
description: Ongoing effect. A character can only have one stance active at a time and can drop a stance by taking a new stance or as a free action at the start of their turn. When a stance refreshes, regain its effects.

name: Summon
description: A character controlled by its Summoner. Abilities that target allied characters cannot target summons unless specifically mentioned. Summons have a summon action that they use on their summoner’s turn, or a summon effect that is always active, but otherwise don’t take actions or movement on their own. By default, summons are size 1, have defense equal to their summoner’s, VIT equal to their summoners, and HP equal to their summoner’s VIT. When reduced to 0 HP, they are removed from the battlefield instead of becoming defeated. They are also removed if their summoner is defeated.

name: Teleport
description: Instantly move to a free space within range X. You can teleport even if your speed is 0.

name: Terrain effect
description: Something that creates or modifies the terrain spaces on the battlefield.

name: Traits
description: Passive abilities, based on your job, class, or your relics, that always apply to your character. These are unique to your job and class.

name: Vitality (VIT)
description: Determines how healthy your character is. Multiply VIT four times to get your Hit Points. When you gain vigor (a shield that goes over your health, usually from healing) it’s equal to a multiple of your VIT. Other effects can heal or damage you you equal to a multiple of your VIT value (25% of your maximum HP), so it’s a quick shorthand.

name: Whack!
description: Kick, punch, or throw something from the environment. As an effect, deal 1 damage to a character in range 3.

name: Wound
description: When you take a wound, fill in 25% of your HP (a value equal to your VIT value), lowering your maximum HP and maximum vigor. You normally get wounds from being defeated. You can’t typically recover or heal a wound until you take an interlude. If you accumulate 4 wounds, you die.

name: Blind
description: Max range of all abilities is 2.

name: Dazed
description: +1 curse on attack rolls.

name: Hatred of X
description: When taking actions against a foe, must include X character as a target for the action to be valid, as long as that character is in line of sight and in range 3 of either you or your target.

name: Pacified
description: Character deals half damage. Breaks on taking damage from an ability.

name: Shattered
description: Character cannot gain or benefit from vigor.

name: Slow
description: Must take slow turns.

name: Branded
description: Attackers gain +1 Boon against this character.

name: Stunned
description: Take 1 less action next turn, then clear this status at the end of that turn.

name: Winded
description: Cannot teleport, dash, or fly.

name: Vulnerable
description: All damage taken increased by 1.

name: Counter
description: Each time a foe deals damage to you with an ability, deal 2 damage back.

name: Defiance
description: Prevents hit points from being reduced past 1 hp. When this triggers, remove this effect and character becomes immune to all damage for the rest of the current turn.

name: Divine
description: Damage from this ability ignores armor, resistance, defiance, and bypasses vigor.

name: Dodge
description: Immune to all damage from misses, successful saves, and area effects.

name: Evasion
description: Roll a d6 when targeted by an attack. On a 4+, the attack automatically misses. Check before the attack roll.

name: Flying
description: A flying character ignores all terrain, objects, and terrain effects other than impassable terrain, and ignores engagement and obstruction.

name: Intangible
description: Can be targeted, but immune to all damage, immobile, and statuses. Doesn’t cause obstruction or engagement.

name: Phasing
description: Can ignore obstruction and pass through, but not end your turn in, terrain, objects, or characters.

name: Pierce
description: Ignores armor.

name: Regeneration
description: Gain vigor 1 at the end of your turn.

name: Skirmisher
description: Can move diagonally, and dash is full speed.

name: Stealth
description: Cannot be directly targeted except from an adjacent space. Breaks on using any ability other than dash.

name: Sturdy
description: Immune to shove, daze, and stun.

name: True Strike
description: Ignores dodge, blind, evasion, and stealth.

name: Unstoppable
description: Immune to all statuses. Immune to being shoved, immobilized, or teleported by foes.

name: Vigilance X
description:
A special effect with X charges. Vigilance charges stack if a character gains more than one. A character can spend a charge of Vigilance for one of the following effects:
• When an ally in range 2 is targeted as part of a foe’s ability, shove that ally 1 space towards you, then shift the target of the ability to you.
• When a foe attempts to break adjacency with you, you may deal fray damage to them and force them to save. On a failed save, they stop and cannot move further with the same effect or ability.

name: Vigor X
description: Gain a shield that goes over your hit points, equal to X times your vitality value. Damage goes to Vigor before Hit Points. Vigor does not stack, and when you gain Vigor you can choose to keep the old value or gain the new value. Lose all vigor at the end of combat.
